title: Compiler panic on big-endian PowerPC 64

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: regression-from-stable-to-beta
labels.description: Performance or correctness regression from stable to beta.

body:
rustc 1.18.0-nightly (ddc5d7bd4 2017-04-20) on Linux ppc64 (big-endian) panics when compiling a doc test from encoding_rs. No panic on x86_64.

Steps to reproduce:

0. Use Linux on big-endian PPC 64 and install nightly Rust via rustup. (I used Fedora 25 in qemu; see #37996 for how. I used `RUSTUP_USE_HYPER=1` to work around rustup having a broken libcurl at the moment.)

1. Clone [encoding_rs](https://github.com/hsivonen/encoding_rs) and checkout the latest commit at the time of filing this issue: `85f3d89ef81d77f35261f510b56aab023b0b9c46`.

2. Run `RUST_BACKTRACE=1 cargo test` in the `encoding_rs` directory.

Expected results:
No compiler panic.
